NoteLiteral.En:
As prerequisite, basic (elementary) knowledge in physics and algebra is preferred.
Applicants need to attach a copy of ID card/passport (document issued by the country of origin) to enrol for the KTU virtual learning environment. This does not apply to KTU students (if you are a KTU student, you may attach a blank page). 
B2 level of English language proficiency is required.

Description.En: What all machines have in common is that they all perform mechanical movements. The micro-module is intended to develop an understanding of the basic structure of mechanical parts of machines, i.e. how motion is obtained in machines. If we are concerned about mobility, or the system that allows motion, we see the core component in it – a machine that performs mechanical motion. The micro-module presents an overview of the main types of mechanisms used in machinery, their kinematical and load capacity properties. Special focus is made on gear mechanisms developing abilities to calculate the necessary power to get the desired motion under loads caused by it, select the mechanism structure, to analyze motion parameters.

NoteLiteral.En: To characterise functional properties of linkages, gear and cam mechanisms in machines and devices and represent their structure schematically by kinematical symbols.

Title.En: Machines for solution of engineering problems

NoteLiteral.En: To discuss feasibility of the application of mechanisms with certain properties for solution of engineering problems.
To determine the basic functional properties of gear mechanisms.

MoreInformation.NoteLiteral:
This micro-module is intended for learners of technological sciences with no background in mechanical engineering or learners in social sciences, humanities, natural or health sciences. The micro-module is divided into three weeks. Each week will start with a video lecture, followed by reading concise materials relevant to the topic and a practical task. The week will end with a self-assessment test.

As prerequisite, basic (elementary) knowledge in physics and algebra is preferred. Core courses in mechanical engineering are not necessary.

[Syllabus of the micro-module](https://uais.cr.ktu.lt/ktuis/stp_report_ects.mdl_ml?p_kodas=MM00M118&p_year=2024&p_lang=EN&p_stp_id=)
Systemized Summary how Machines perform mechanical movements and transform energy, materials or information

The micro-module provides the student with structured information on the general principles of the generation and transmission of motion in machines, i.e. how motion is generated, how and by what means it is transmitted within the machine, and how the required parameters of motion are obtained.

As prerequisite, basic (elementary) knowledge in physics and algebra is preferred.

Applicants need to attach a copy of ID card/passport (document issued by the country of origin) to enrol for the KTU virtual learning environment. This does not apply to KTU students (if you are a KTU student, you may attach a blank page). 

B2 level of English language proficiency is required.
